did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Legal Department records 1936-1979
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the largest and oldest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) Legal Department Records contain releases for models and photographers associated with JWT campaigns between 1936-1979, and especially the 1950s. The collection also contains publications associated with JWT clients which required model releases. Companies represented in the collection include Ford, Gillette, Kodak, Lever Brothers, Pacific Mills (Cocheco Manufacturing Company), Pan American World Airways, Quaker Oats, Radio Corporation of America (RCA), Seven-Up, Singer, and Uncle Ben's. Photographers mentioned or whose work appears in the collection include Richard Avedon, Ralph Bartholomew, Anton Bruehl, Horst, Otto Mayo, Valentino Sarra, and Francesco Scavullo. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, materials may not be photocopied.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: J. Walter Thompson Legal Department Records, 1936-1979, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Legal Department Records, were pulled from storage by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1986.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The JWT Legal Department Records date from 1936-1979, with the majority of materials dating from the 1950s. The collection primarily contains release forms, photographs and publications associated with JWT campaigns. The collection also contains routine legal contracts which list the terms of agreement between the client, talent and the J. Walter Thompson Company. Companies represented in the collection include Ford, Gillette, Kodak, Lever Brothers, Pacific Mills (Cocheco Manufacturing Company), Pan American , Quaker Oats, Radio Corporation of America (RCA), Seven-Up, Singer, and Uncle Ben's. Photographers mentioned or whose work appears in the collection include Richard Avedon, Ralph Bartholomew, Anton Bruehl, Horst, Otto Mayo, Valentino Sarra, and Francesco Scavullo.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into six series: Model Releases, Photographers, Publications, Reports, Model-Client-Date Cards, and Overscale Talent Releases. The Model Releases Series and the Photographers Series contain photographs and photostats of models as they often appeared in an advertisement. Attached to the visual is a signed release by the model specifying the length of the contract, the client and the date. The Publications Series contains an assortment of publications requiring model releases, and especially Ford newsletters from the 1950s. The Reports Series consists of contour sheets for Pacific Mills, as well as a Kodak marketing consideration. The Model-Client Date Cards Series consist of index cards of models used by the various clients. The Overscale Talent Releases Series include routine legal contracts which list the terms of agreement between the client, talent and the J. Walter Thompson Company. They specify the length of the contract, the client and the date. The bulk of the contracts are in their original format and therefore have actual signatures of the talent. Overscale refers to the fact that these contracts remunerated above normal union scale wages.

The Model Releases are arranged alphabetically by client and then by model and date. The Photographers files are arranged alphabetically by photographer and then by client and date. The Publications are arranged alphabetically by client and then by the name of the publication and date. Reports are arranged by client. The Model-Client index cards are arranged alphabetically by model in the first two boxes and by client (Kodak only) in the third box. The Overscale Talent Releases are arranged alphabetically by client, then by the talent name and then by date.

scopecontent.p: Restrictions on Access: Materials may not be photocopied.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Correspondence, mundane visuals and releases, and advertisements were removed from the collection. The advertisements were relocated in RG 10 Proof Collection. Drafts of the releases and correspondence pertaining to the releases have been removed from the collection. [Per JWT Archivist notes prior to the transfer of records to Duke University.]

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections of the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives:

extref.emph: Sidney Ralph Bernstein Company History Files

scopecontent.p: Consists of photographs and photostats of models as they often appeared in an advertisement. Attached to the images is a signed release by the model. The model releases are arranged alphabetically by client and then by model and date.

Contains photographs and photostats of models as they often appeared in advertisements. Attached to these images are signed releases by models. Items are arranged alphabetically by photographer and then by client and date.

Contains an assortment of publications which required model releases, and especially Ford newsletters from the 1950s. The materials are arranged alphabetically by client and then by the name of the publication and date.

did.unittitle: March...March...March...The Fifth Year of the March, 1959-1960

scopecontent.p: Consists of two folders relating to JWT clients Pacific Mills and Kodak. The Pacific Mills folder contains files related to the introduction of contour sheets from the years 1949-1953. The Kodak folder details a marketing consideration from 1970. The folders were arranged alphabetically by client.

Series includes three black boxes with index cards of models used by the various clients. Items are arranged alphabetically by model in the first two boxes and by client (Kodak only) in the third box.

Includes routine legal contracts which list the terms of agreement between the client, talent and the J. Walter Thompson Company. They specify the length of the contract, the client and the date. The bulk of the contracts are in their original format and therefore have actual signatures of the talent. Overscale refers to the fact that these contracts remunerated above normal union scale wages.
